Reviews.Title: “A rotten gem?”
Reviews.Author: KatriViktor
Reviews.Content: The doors have very bad locks, the room smells funny, the music is VERY loud during the nights, the warm water runs out in the mornings, la chica in the reception told us to visit a doctor that costs 70 USD just for visit when a near by doctor on av. Juarez costs 70 pesos (luckily we found it before paying the 70 USD!), there's not enough security lockers for all guests, cleaning lady didn't clean every day, the airconditioner didn't work properly - it was cold and then hot. Good things: location. Looks nice from the outside. Must have been a very nice place before the mould and discos.

Reviews.Title: “So sorry to have to be brutal”
Reviews.Author: nathanwaks
Reviews.Content: OK so it's either a hidden gem or the worst ever- according to other reviews. Guess what! oth right. We came here 11 years ago and discovered this lovely laid back, simple hotel on the beach at what was then sleepy but beautiful Playa del Carmen. Well, 11 years is a long time and now Playa del Carmen is a sophisticated resort with many hotel options- Costa del Mar hasn't changed- rooms still simple but clean and functional and the location by the beach is great, BUT there are now several all night open air discos on the street about 50 metres away (Calle 12) and we could here them all, all night long pounding through our room, so if you want to party or have excellent ear plugs this will be fine- if not you have been warned....it is really really loud until about 5 am.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad to be true”
Reviews.Author: Ale_ND
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly because of its location, right on the beach. I regret so much not having read these reviews, we would have saved money and time, and a good night sleep... First of all, i have to admit the guy in the lobby was friendly but our dissapointment began when we opened the door to an awfully musty smell, as if the rooms were not open in months to let air in... the lamp between the beds was burnt and almost breaking into pieces, the bathroom looked clean but really primitive. We hadnt spent 5 minutes in that room when we asked for another one.. oh man! The second bedroom itself was not that bad, but the bathroom... the light and bathroom fixtures: Non existent, the toilet hadnt been cleaned in days, the shower floor and walls hadnt been brushed between mosaics so you could actually see the mold growing up there. This bedroom hadnt been dusted in days! It was late so we decided to stay just for the night... and then the fun part begun.. this hotel is located near one of the loudest corners in Playa so you can imagine how well we rested that night... The next morning we talked to one of the managers and showed her the awful conditions of the bedrooms, she was understanding but never offered any kind of apology not even the refund (or the solution to get one..) when we said we were leaving, after that we saw 2 cleaning ladies dusting and brushing the room but it was TOO LATE!. We had booked another hotel... Seriously, this is not the place to stay if you are looking for cleanliness and peaceful nights. This hotel is ONLY for those who like to party all night and sleep during the day. It is such a waste because the location itself is good and it does look good from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “great gem! located on the beach”
Reviews.Author: crazycabobob
Reviews.Content: Been to playa four times (so far) . This trip we were forced out of our regular place because of construction and found this place walking back to get our car. Great value for a place on the beach not to mention free parking and 24/7 security. Good food, drinks, pool, and Steve's dive/snorkle shop just next door. Rooms are very clean and the maids leave you a new towel animal every day. The A/C works VERY well (not noisy) and lots of hot water when it gets to your shower. Can be a little loud at night because of the local clubs but WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but beware of noise”
Reviews.Author: anditiger
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers. We got a fantastic deal. We were stranded in the area after our flights to Cuba were cancelled. It was one of the only hotels in town we could drive up to. The staff were friendly. Great spot right on the beach with deck chair service (love the buckets of beer) and great snacks, all inexpensive. Was a short walk to the strip for food and drinking, although I would get off the strip for the best value and best food. The picked the room closest to the beach. Big Mistake. At 11pm the music started and not just a bit of noise. It felt like the club was happening in our room. I asked security at 12.30am when it was going to finish and they told me 4.30am and every night at that. The next day we moved to a quieter room. Though I must say the noise was probably drowned out by the sound of the air con which was loud. But better that then doof. Rooms were basic, but clean. They make fantastic towel sculptures for you everyday. very cute.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, be aware”
Reviews.Author: TNH33
Reviews.Content: This part of town has been taken over by open air nightclubs that blast music up to 4:30 AM. They don't warn you about this and will offer you a discount if you pay cash for your stay upfront and there is NO REFUND. The rooms smell mouldy and are starting to fall to pieces because they are clearly going out of business. Of course, this place will suit you if you don't plan on sleeping at night and you want to be right were it is all happening.

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel - but noisy”
Reviews.Author: patyhart
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times, since the mid 80's to be exact. Used to be a quiet beautiful area and beach, with a simple hotel on the beautiful beach. We used to get a couple of beers and sit on chairs on the beach at night and look at the lights of Cozumel and listen to the waves come in. Over the years however, the owners have tried to compete with the upscale hotels and younger crowd by offering loud (that doesn't even begin to decribe the NOISE) thump thump music and lots of drinking and partying. It is a popular place from midnight till 4AM, so ... If you want a quiet plush hotel with all the ammenities, then don't stay here. If you don't plan on sleeping at night, have no children or want to just let loose and really party hearty, then this is the place for you. Food at the bar is good. Beds (as in most hotels in Mexico) are hard as rocks. Facilities are just sparse (no telephone, few good TV channels if you don't speak Spanish), but the owners and workers are really kind and want to be very helpful. We still stop in a say hi, although we now stay elsewhere where the noise is not loud.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Us”
Reviews.Author: gvgirl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is my biggest complaint. When we booked, we did not realize it was next to the LOUDEST disco on the beach. The music THUMPED until 4:30 AM. We were near the office on the street side and could still hear the music reverberating through the walls. We got no rest what so ever! I realize this is not the hotel owners problem, but there should be a warning before booking. The room was of normal size . It was very damp and smelly in the room too. We tried to take a shower in the afternoon but quickly discovered they didn't turn on the hot water circulator until 4:30 in the afternoon. Needless to say we had cold showers. The beds were incredibly hard ( not to mention, the box springs were a concrete slab). The office staff was friendly and accomodating. We were close to the beach but their portion was very small and crowded. If you just need a place to store your things while you walk around, it might work for you. but if you plan to actually relax- this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: IAH
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed 1 night at Costa del Mar in Nov 2007. This is great location, 1 block from 5th Ave. and right on the beach! The hotel is a value during low season rates. Rooms are clean but a bit sparse but that's OK as much time isn't spent in the room anyway. Costa del Mar has a beach bar as part of the property, El Pirata. Great place to sit and chill at the swing bar while sipping a few cervezas. I would recommend Costa del Mar to friends. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “great bang for the buck on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: becker4ever
Reviews.Content: If you like to be pampered and stay in resorts and can't speak any Spanish - don't stay here! This hotel is clean, on the beach, good cheap food on the beach, fun beach bar, nice people who don't speak English very well. Right next to Blue Parrot, so this is a party spot...you have your kids with you? You don't like music and noise? DON'T STAY HERE. You want to enjoy the culture, be on the beach, be safe and sound in a nice clean room and have money left over to party and dive - stay here - great place! Comparable to a motel 6 along a highway to nowhere as far as luxury....you may even have a pet lizard in your room when you first arrive - ha! THIS IS A GREAT LITTLE HOTEL FOR THE PRICE - The people who complained about mold, noise, ect...were not prepared for what they paid for. You won't find a better price for a nice clean place on the beach just up the block from 5th avenue. ..this is a very fun location....be nice to the locals and they will be nice to you....you are in Mexico!...why pay to stay in a resort that excludes you from the locals and culture - save some money and meet some fun people. We are staying here in Novevmber too (2007) - NO WORRIES - FUN LITTLE BEACH FRONT PLACE! Oh yah - beds in Mexico are hard as a rock unless you stay at a resort, so learn how to ask for a matress pad in Spanish or bring one in an extra duffle bag!

Reviews.Title: “Mold and noise”
Reviews.Author: tourismprof
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in room 23. The smell in the bathroom was awful but I guess we were lucky - our colleagues in room 25 had to deal with even more disgusting moldy smell. The shower was dripping and nothing in the room ever got dry. We were happy that our airconditioning didn't work. We heard from others that it got really cold during the night and there was no way to turn the AC off (at least they couldn't find a switch). We had breakfast included but nobody at the bar knew anything about it. Our tourguide had to intervene. The ham and cheese omelette was fantastic, though. As other travelers have noted, the noise is substantial and there are no beach towels available. Great location and nice exterior but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: RocketLagunaNiguel
Reviews.Content: Stay away! Loud Music all night till 4 am. Use to be a cool mellow Reggae Bar...now they are trying to compete with the loud music from the Blue Parrot next door. I stayed at the Hotel Colibri next door and the music was still loud...I had to keep all doors and window shut till 4 am everyday...only then i could finally open them and Listen to the sound of the surf. Buyer Beware!

Reviews.Title: “rude and deceptive management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Costa del Mar two nights in advance (and pre-paid one night...cash as required) because my hotel accross the street (Tropicana Casablanca) did not have a room for the night in question, pending cancellation. According to their web site, Costa del Mar said that I could cancel within 24 hours. Subsequently, later that same day, the Tropicana Casablanca notified me of a cancellation. When I went back across the street to cancel the reservation, I was told that there would be a 25% penalty, despite the fact that the reservation wasn't until Friday and this was Wednesday. Fortunately, my son, who is fluent in Spanish, talked the Mexican woman running the desk (who was polite, as was the Mexican desk clerk) into calling her superior and getting the penalty reduced to 10%. It should have been no penalty, but I figured it was worth the ten bucks and said, "fine." If that had been all that happened, it would have been merely annoying. To add insult to injury, however, an older woman (probably American, but fluent in Spanish) who had been sitting in a chair with a cane was apparently affiliated with the hotel and said, "Why did you make the reservation if you were going to cancel?" When I gave the explanation above, she said, repeated her question in a hostile tone of voice. After a second, more brusque reply, she said sarcastically, "Oh no, it's ok. That's fine." To which I replied, "If it's fine, why did you intervene and ask me the question in the first place." Finally, I just walked out. She was clearly annoyed and it was clear to her that I was not happy that she had injected herself into the issue without being invited. Bottom line: There are plenty of nice hotels in Playa that are reasonable, well located, AND who won't try to scam you. The Tropicana Casablanca across the street is cheaper and much more quiet and Los Itzaes on 10th has very spacious rooms, a great quiet location, and with an excellent staff who are uniformly polite, and at least bi-lingual. Either would be vastly preferable to Hotel Costa del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestPlayaLuvr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great 5-night stay at the Costa del Mar. We were in room 23, lower level close to the office. Overall, we feel that this hotel is a very good value for the money. Following are the positives and negatives: POSITIVES: 1) The hotel is clean and you can't beat the location - right on the most beautiful stretch of beach in Playa. 2) Close to 5th Ave. - all the great restaurants and shops are easily within walking distance. 3) The hotel staff is pleasant, including the waiters at El Pirata (the bar and restaurant at the hotel). 4) The food was inexpensive and good.....don't miss the grilled ham sandwich with fresh pineapple! Very tasty!! Drinks were average but the prices were good - couldn't beat the chair-side service. If you tip the waiters decently, they'll take good care of you. 5) The showers in the rooms are nice and large - very good for tall people like my finace! 6) The hotel grounds were clean and pretty. 7) Next door to the Blue Parrot - a great bar with nightly specials and nightly fire dances at 11PM - worth watching! Also has a big dance floor and nice atmosphere.....definitely one of the most popular night spots in Playa. NEGATIVES: 1) The hotel rooms do not have phones in them, and the beds are hard. 2) The noisy music from the bar lasts until 3 AM and as other have said, you can also hear the music from the Blue Parrot late into the night. Bring earplugs! 3) The A/C blocks out much of the noise, but it gets very cold in the room after a while (because you cannot regulate the temp. - A/C only has an on/off switch). I wouldn't recommend this hotel for little children because of the noise issue. 4) We were never given washclothes or hand towels - you might want to bring some from home. Also bring beach towels - they do not provide. 5) The bathrooms are small and the lighting could be better. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay. Nothing about the rooms was luxurious - BUT, once on the beach, it didn't matter. The essentials were provided and for the price, you can't beat it! I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Playa on the cheap, but still have a great time and be close to the action. For $65 a night, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Reservations are a joke even with a CC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading a post regarding overbooking during peak season I called today to verify our reservation that we made 5 weeks ago and confirmed with a Credit Card. Sure enough they we totally messed up. Had us in a Cabana room with no A/C for the first two nights, moving to a larger A/C room as reserved originally for the third and forth, out on the street I guess(standby) for nights five and six and finally back to the reserved room for the last four nights. What kind of reservation system is this? I have stayed there before because it was cheap, but I just lost any savings in the past after being forced to find a last minute hotel during Spring Break in Cancun nontheless :(. Last time I stay there. As a side note, if you are kept awake by music, opt for a room closer to the road. The A/C Rooms have less bugs in them. The A/C units can freeze you out of the rooms as well since they are either on or off. Still cheap though. Beware the pool. Great steaks though and great bar staff. Not worth the risk during peak travel seasons though.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An Awesome Vacation hotel for people enjoying the night life. our group consisted of 4 single men in our late 20's. The location of the hotel could not be better, just feet from the beach and a very short walk to the main avenue. Not a place particularly for young children, the bar was open til at least 3:30 am playing loud music. in our room with the a/c on in the window shut the noise was not a problem on the one night I just couldn't go out. Even though I did not know a lick of spanish everybody at the hotel and beachbar understood my english.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: crinaea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Costa del Mar for two nights Nov 27-29, 2004 (room #19, upstairs about halfway along). The room was adequate - clean, and a nice large shower, and the price was great - US$60 - for the location. The beach was about fifteen feet from our room. Re other reviews, we didn't think the bed was that hard - particularly compared to other hotels in the area, although the mattress is thin. As with other hotels in P del C, the air smells a little musty, from the humidity, but there's AC (albeit only with an on/off option) and a fan. The main downside is that you can't open the window at night because of the noise from the bar - which was bad on Sat night, and ok on Sunday. But the price is great for a beachside hotel in P del C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--But BYO Door Knob”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Costa Del Mar April 7 - 10, 2004 (a family of four...two adults, two kids ages 12 & 17). The hotel was very crowded, as it was Easter week and that is when many Mexican families vacation. We had the last room, next to the pool. The room was large and relatively clean. We paid $70/night US, (less than what I was quoted). I found out once we got into the room that this probably was because there was no door knob or handle on the inside of the door...making it rather tricky to get out. When brought to the manager's attention, he tried rigging up a wire hanger as a make-shift handle, but to no avail. He said the next day that maintenance would fix it. They didn't. The next day came, and it wasn't fixed. When I asked if it was going to be fixed, I was simply told "no". Despite there being 4 people in the room, we were only ever given two towels. When I asked for additional towels, I was told there were none. It's a good thing I brought some beach towels from home! Noise was not an issue, as we had a room with a/c. A/C was an issue because the temperature couldn't be adjusted. It was either on or off, that's it. As mentioned in previous reviews, the location can't be beat. It's right on the beach and a very short walk to 5th Ave. Also, if you have a rental car, there is off street parking on the property. There is a small pool, which we did not use, as it looked dirty and full of sand. The guac at El Pirata was good, the $ of food and cervezas were good. All in all, $70 to stay at a hotel with such a great location is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great if your 20, sharing, and on a tight budget!”
Reviews.Author: cgarland_wetcoast
Reviews.Content: I agree - a good location, but be forewarned it is party central right next to the Blue Parrot. Overpriced cabanas - for $42 US booked on cancunsmart. Bedding - comes with an array of bed bugs and permanent stained linens. Bugs chewing through wardrobe wood, and surrounding the bathroom walls, mirror and sink. No separator or curtain between toilet and shower. Hard bed (like sleeping on plywood). Ceiling fan coated with dust. Blue Parrot plays technomusic until 4am, El Pirata plays one Bob Marley CD on endless loop until 3 am, a restaurant to the North plays jazz until 12, boisterious drunk patrons coming and going at all hours and making themselves comfy in my hammock outside the cabana...I had 1 hour of sleep that night. The next night we moved to the main building near the street entrance which was slightly better with less bed bugs, but the noise was still an issue. No safety deposit box in rooms, have to leave things in reception office. Service was very friendly though. Cleaner, quieter hotels available further down 5th ave but still close to the beach for 350 pesos/nt with air con, ceiling fan, tv.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location but......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Costa Del Mar for one week and loved being right on the beach for a reasonable price. We stayed in a cabana (no air con) and it was clean but very basic. It was also great to have a restaurant/bar on site. The down side for us was once it got dark it started hopping with LOUD music. Music also bled from the hotels to the north so sleeping was too much of a challenge. We tried to get into a regular room thinking we could use the air con to block some of the sound but they were all booked. We moved to another hotel for our last week and were truely greatful to get some sleep. Good place for those who like the night life! It seems to be geared to the younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cosalamx
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the beach and a block from the pedestrian mall (Quinta Avenue). Very uncomfortable Mexican style bed - a thin mattress on a wooden frame, but probably ok if you are younger. The ambiance was fine and the staff most accomodating. Room was kept very clean. A little noisy mostly from the hotel next door with fire dancing performances every night at 11 p.m. on the beach (the performances were very good), so ask for a room closer to the street than the beach if you like to sleep before 2 a.m., then it is tolerable. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a brief holiday at the Costa del Mar. Right on the beach, it was a pleasant surprise!I stayed in one of the cheaper cabaÃ±a rooms. It was a small, simple room with a thatched roof and a ceiling fan which provided plenty of cool breezes; however, air-conditioned rooms were also available. The room was clean and the bed was firm but comfortable.The towels were thick but if you want a wash cloth or hand towel, you will need to bring them. The staff were always pleasant to talk with.The El Pirata bar on the beach offers tasty, inexpensive food and drinks. Only MX$10 for draft beer!

Reviews.Title: “just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: theresa
Reviews.Content: we stayed in one of the rooms on the ground floor with air. it was straight mexican and it was just what we were looking for. a little ruff around the edges but its all in what your looking for. an authentic mexican holiday, yes, or a resort with a gigantic pool. not for you if thats the case. located right on the beach, excellent people willing to please and great management. we got 1 free night for extended stay. their always willing to deal. deposits box in the room not secure and had to get some plumbing looked at, but not a problem. treat them well and they will treat you well back. try the shrimp cocktail at the little resturant. cheap meals and good.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enanita
Reviews.Content: We arrived a this hotel by accident because the hotel that we reserve from the internet was a total desaster. Disappointed we look to find something nicer and there we are... little hotel , nice and warm welcome at the front desk.. almost directly on the beach... quiet at night, clean, clean clean . We take the section with air conditionning and a ventilator.. we were really at paradise. We had a great stay there and Alejandra at the front desk was really nice ! I would recommand this hotel anytime. We paid $ 75.us considering it was august... Price was reasonnable and the room really really pleasant.
